intro: Monnina crotalarioides var. leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stamened monnina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and modest flowering display.
